name: Contentreich
summary:
We are Andreas and Sandra, and we are IT freelancing from Hamburg focused on Alfresco since 2006. We support all phases of a project, but we also give short support gigs in case there is a problem which needs to be fixed quickly.

We emphasize on shipping value quickly using very short iterations. Effective communication matters a lot. We think it is crucial to leverage audio and even video frequently, because it just works best. With good communication in place, distance is rarely an issue.

Code has issues and maintenance is boring. That's why we aim at producing as little code as possible.

Over the years, we built a zoo of more than 100 add-ons/tweaks we maintain today.

We are very honest. Even if we expect disagreement or deal breakers.

name: ecm4u
summary:
ecm4u is a company focused on and specialized in solutions for document management, process and case management based on Alfersco in any flavor. ecm4u supports many organisations in running, maintaining and extending their Alfresco system (either Community or Enterprise) for small to very large systems and maintains it's own "ecm4u Alfresco Virtual Appliance" to make install, maintenance and support easier and better. Patches we create for our community support customers find their way into our public patch Repositories.

Beside Alfresco support, consulting and remote management the ecm4u team develops products and solutions which makes Alfresco more usable in business processes and use cases.

name: DGCloud
summary: DGCloud deploys customised Document Management System (DMS) solutions based on Alfresco that allow you to simplify your business. Through the provision of integrated solutions for content management and process automation, our customers can realise the maximum potential of their digital assets with low cost, high professional quality and efficiency.

name: Daniel Gradecak
summary:
I build custom solutions based on Alfresco and many time there is a complete custom UI involved.

As all of the 'alfrescians' I work with Share too and build custom widgets. To describe my work I would say Alfresco system integrator :) as there is a lot of integration that has to be done in order to have a functional application (from simple custom DB access to custom content store).

name: Metaversant
summary:
Metaversant offers consulting services around open source content management technology. We are Alfresco experts but our passion extends to a number of content management, business process management, and search technologies.

We build custom solutions designed to help you share your digital assets with the right people, at the right time, in a secure way. Metaversant consultants have been helping Fortune 500 and Global 2000 clients collaborate around rich media, unstructured, and semi-structured data for nearly 20 years.

Our team is led by Jeff Potts, a well-respected member of the Alfresco community. We are headquartered in Dallas, Texas, but our clients are all over the world.

repos.name: Source code from the Alfresco Developer Series tutorials

name: Loftux
summary:
Loftux AB is a company specialized in solutions for document management and more general information management based on open source products and Alfresco.

Loftux AB can offer you services around analysis, implementation, training and support. We will help you get started and reach the true value of the information you have stored in a fast and cost effective way.

name: keensoft
summary:
keensoft provides consulting and development services related to content management based on Alfresco. We have also wide experience on mobility, record management, big data and electronic signature.

Our task is analyze, design and deliver IT solutions which help our customers to achieve their most ambitious goals. Our services are offered in a quick and pragmatic way.

We have been collaborating with large companies in Spain and UK, building together creative solutions around content delivery.

name: Magenta Aps
summary:
Magenta provides solutions for content management, integrations, web and design. We have delivered Content Management Systems and document management primarily to large public sector institutions since 1999.

Over the recent years we have worked intensely on becoming the leading Danish supplier of products and services based on the concept 'open computing', meaning a solid focus on open standards and open source.

Magenta has specialised in developing advanced IT solutions, that not only function in the purely technical way, but also help our clients improving their communication and reaching their targets. We are able to do this because we have a strict focus on usability and user needs in our design information architecture and functionality.

repos.name: OpenESDH: Open Electronic document and records management

name: Tomas Kubik
summary: I develop, teach and integrate Alfresco from version 3.4 to actual. I build many custom advanced workflows with Activiti engine or Bonita engine integrated with Alfresco. I develop many customization, widgets and dashlets for Share. Everything, every idea, is possible with Alfresco! :-)

name: Paolo Predonzani
summary:
I'm an Alfresco Certified Engineer specialised in Share customisations, advanced workflows and integration with existing applications.

I can help customers start their first project with Alfresco or I can work on the customer's existing code.

I have international professional experience, including 4 years in the UK. International enquiries are welcome.

repos.name: An Alfresco uploader that prompts for metadata
An inbox plugin for Alfresco implemented using the Aikau framework

name: aegif
summary:
aegif is a consulting firm specialized in ECM, it was the first Alfresco partner in Asia, and offers consulting, integration, support and training for Alfresco.

aegif authored most of Alfresco's Japanese localization, and runs a bi-monthly Alfresco user group in Tokyo. Rooted in the Open Source and interoperability movement, aegif strongly believes in the power of the CMIS protocol, and has emerged as Asia's CMIS specialist.

name: Venzia IT
summary: Venzia IT is a Spanish open source company specialized in consulting, development and integration of Java/J2EE products since 2004, strongly focused in Alfresco ECM/WCM expertise. Its activity covers web content solutions (WCM/ECM), Business Processes (BPM) and Business Inteligence (BI).

name: Softbless
summary: PT Softbless Solutions was established in 2008, specializes in web based open source solutions. Softbless Solutions offers a variety of services and has the ability to implement, configure and support and optimize a wide assortment of open source technologies, some won a prestigious 2010 BOSSIE award which was held by InfoWorld.

name: Brightcookie Pty Ltd
summary:
Brightcookie Pty Ltd is an Adelaide South Australia based Online Learning Specialist company supporting clients in anything related to the delivery of Online Learning. Clients are typically Educational & Training Providers in the Schools, VET (Adult Education) and Higher Education Sector as well as corporate training departments.

Brightcookie Pty has used Alfresco Community Edition for over 5 years now to support some of their larger clients with Alfresco CE as a Learning Object Repository with associated workflows to produce these Learning Materials. Brightcookie Pty has also connected Alfresco to a number of Learning Management Systems (such as Moodle LMS) as well as Social Learning Platforms.

name: Majestic Computer Technology
summary:
Majestic DEV is a leader in IT infrastructure, planning and networking. Majestic DEV is a single source provider for total network solutions; transforming technology into business solutions. Majestic DEV brings to its customers broad experience in data, cloud and security communications.

Majestic DEV Computer Technology has been offering alfresco community solutions to the clients since 2012 in Australia.

repos.name: A WordPress Plugin to display document from Alfresco
A Joomla module to display document from Alfresco

name: B Circle Co., Ltd.
summary:
B Circle is a company specialized in document management, document scanning and document workflow based on Alfresco and community version and Activiti. We are very active promote Alfresco to Thailand.

B Circle offers the following services:

  • Our completed Alfresco DMS base on Community 5.x
  • Easy capture “Smart scanning for Alfresco”
  • Paperless Workflow solution for Alfresco
  • Custom Alfresco interface to another system
  • Migration a million of document from legacy DMS to Alfresco with advance content model
  • Services around analysis, implementation, customization, training and support Alfresco

blogs.title: Alfresco and Document management Knowledge Base
Youtube Chanel Free Alfresco Community 5.1 Training and Alfresco Knowledge

name: Contezza
summary: Contezza is the leading Dutch expert in implementing information management using Alfresco. We implement Alfresco for organizations, design and develop customizations and integrations and are the application hosting and management partner for over 20 organizations.

repos.name: Alfresco Module to get Email notification on update of content

name: Zylk.net
summary:
Zylk.net is an open IT company situated in Bilbao (Spain), specialized in open-source solutions and driving digital transformation for a wide range of clients including private enterprise, public administrations and government bodies across Spain and Europe. Since 2004, we have provided expertise on the design, development and integration of Java open-source enterprise products, specialising in Document Management (Alfresco), Enterprise Portals (Liferay), Big Data (Hortonworks, Hadoop), Business Intelligence (Pentaho) and Digital Signature (Sinadura) solutions. The company has been awarded the ISO20000-1 quality certificate standard for supporting service management systems.

Zylk team is a Silver partner of Liferay Portal and Hortonworks, with a highly experienced (+6 years) team, trained and certified in Alfresco ECM (ACA and ACE). Zylk is expert in Alfresco integrations and customizations, for example custom authentication subsystems or digital signature addons. The team participates actively in the Alfresco Community, including Alfresco forums and events such Alfresco Meetups, Days and Summits, and recently Beecon. The company blog "No Blogo" features an extensive number of Alfresco-related posts, including technical advice and case studies of Alfresco in enterprise.

repos.name: Online edition with Libreoffice in Alfresco Share
